name: Idolic Deity
resistance: cold; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
conimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Stealth in darkness
traits.desc: The idolic diety gains an additional +3 to Stealth (+11 in total) in dim light or darkness.

traits.name: Apostasy Aura
traits.desc: The idolic deity's presence causes devout followers to doubt their faith. A cleric or paladin that can see the idolic deity and wishes to cast a spell or use a class feature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell or class feature is spent as if it was used, but it has no effect.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The idolic deity can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the idolic deity can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The idolic deity uses Seduce the Righteous and makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Seduce the Righteous
actions.desc: The idolic deity targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The target has disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, or ability checks (the idolic deity chooses which) until the end of its next turn. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the target prevents this effect, as does a magic circle.
